articles.title: Meeting of Military Education Officers of KPA Held in Presence of Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Meeting of Military Education Officers of KPA Held in Presence of Kim Jong Un
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The 7th Meeting of Military Education Officers of the Korean People's Army (KPA) was held at the April 25 House of Culture on Tuesday and Wednesday.
					 Supreme Commander of the KPA Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, was present at the meeting.
					
					 Also present there were Hwang Pyong So, Pak Yong Sik, Ri Yong Gil and other commanding officers of the KPA and exemplary military education officers, teachers and employees of military education institutions and officials of merit in the relevant field.
					
					 KPA Vice Marshal Hwang Pyong So, director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, made a report at the meeting.
					
					 The reporter said:
					
					 The great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il hewed the arduous path at the outset of the Songun revolution and in this course founded the Juche-oriented idea and theory of military education and wisely led the struggle for embodying them, thus performing immortal feats which would go down in the history of the development of revolutionary armed forces.
					
					 Their idea of the Juche-based military education and educational tradition are being successfully carried forward and developed on a new high stage under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The reporter called for bringing about a radical turn in military education true to the noble intention of the Supreme Commander who provided a big assembly of military education officers to be specially recorded in the history of army building and thus usher in a new heyday in bolstering up military muscle.
					
					 The report was followed by speeches of KPA generals and officers.
					
					 Kim Jong Un made an important speech at the meeting.
					
					 In his speech he highly appreciated once again the achievements the military education officers have made in the military education in the past and indicated tasks and ways for improving and strengthening the military education as required by the developing reality by thoroughly implementing the Party's policy of making a revolution in military education.
					
					 He noted that military education is a very important and responsible work for training core and backbone elements of the KPA and patriotic one of lasting significance for the development of the revolutionary armed forces and the prosperity of the country.
					
					 The great leaders always paid deep attention to strengthening military education in the whole period of founding and leading our revolutionary armed forces and energetically led the work for consolidating the core base of the KPA by channeling great efforts into military education even in the period of the most rigorous trials, he added.
					
					 He stressed that if the KPA is to creditably discharge the noble mission and duty it assumed before the era and history, it should bolster up the military capability in every way by thoroughly carrying out the Party's policy of making a revolution in military education.
					
					 Pointing out that the aim of the said revolution is to usher in the greatest heyday in boosting the military capability by decisively raising the qualitative level of military education as required by modeling the whole army on  Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, he said that the Party hopes at present to see the KPA duly become a model and a pace-setter in the society in the education and the work of training talents.
					
					 It is the duty of military education for the military schools at all levels to train all cadets as the strongest in thinking and the sense of moral obligation who absolutely trust and follow and devotedly defend our Party and field commanding officers and persons of ability capable of skillfully organizing and commanding modern operations and combats, he emphasized.
					
					 The seed of the revolution in military education is to build up well the ranks of teachers of military schools at all levels, decisively raise their responsibility and role and the said revolution is, in essence, the work for bringing about a radical change among teachers, he said, and went on:
					
					 The main link in the chain efforts for making the said revolution is to arouse great enthusiasm for learning among cadets and they are main players in the said revolution.
					
					 The main thrust of the said revolution is to effect steady innovation in the contents and methods of education. It is necessary to focus efforts on improving educational contents and methods as required by the era and developing revolution.
					
					 In order to thoroughly implement the Party's policy of making a revolution in military education it is necessary to improve the educational administration and regularize and standardize the management and operation of schools.
					
					 He underscored the need to properly establish the system of guidance over military education, raise the responsibility and role of guiding officers and improve the Party's guidance over the military education.
					
					 A letter of pledge to him was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Spokesman for DPRK FM on Japan-S. Korea Summit
articles.content:
Spokesman for DPRK FM on Japan-S. Korea Summit
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry Thursday gave the following answer to the question put by KCNA as regards the decision of Japan and south Korea to make efforts to seek an early solution to the issue of "comfort women for the Imperial Japanese Army."
					 It was reported that the Japan-south Korea summit held in Seoul early in November decided to accelerate the discussion on seeking an early solution to the said issue.
					
					 As the whole world knows, the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army committed by the state of Japan in an organized manner in the period of the Japanese imperialists' occupation of Korea and during World War II is one of the crimes which Japan should redress without fail as it is the most hideous human rights abuses to which no statute of limitations is applicable because it savagely violated the dignity, virginity and physical bodies of women.
					
					 In the period of Japan's occupation of Korea for over 40 years in the last century Japan forcibly drafted at least 8.4 million Koreans, massacred more than one million, forced 200 000 Korean women into sexual slaves, forced Koreans to change their names into Japanese ones and committed such unheard-of monstrous crimes as conducting tests on living bodies. It, however, shunned redemption of those crimes though seven decades have passed since its defeat in the war.
					
					 The most cruel and despicable crimes are not such things that allow the assailant to deal with them with one victimized party only out of the victims to gloss over them.
					
					 This issue can hardly find a final solution unless the damage suffered by all Koreans is redressed throughout Korea because there are victims of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army not only in the south of Korea but also in the north.
					
					 Japan should admit the state responsibility for all hideous crimes committed against the Korean people including the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army and the damage done by them and make reparation for them in such a manner as to be understandable to all Koreans.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets New Indian Ambassador
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets New Indian Ambassador
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong met and had a talk with   , new Indian ambassador to the DPRK who paid a courtesy call on him on Thursday.

articles.title: World Gymnastic Gold Medalist of DPRK Back Home
articles.content:
World Gymnastic Gold Medalist of DPRK Back Home
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- DPRK player Ri Se Gwang who proved successful in the 46th Artistic Gymnastics World Championships returned home on Thursday.
					 He was greeted by Kim Yong Hun, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, Ri Jong Mu, general of the Korean People's Army, officials concerned and his family at Pyongyang Railway Station.
					
					 Sportspersons congratulated Ri Se Gwang on his success in the match, presenting garlands and bouquets to him.

articles.title: Delegation of Young Officials of Chongryon Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Delegation of Young Officials of Chongryon Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The delegation of young officials of Chongryon (General Association of Korean Residents in Japan) led by Jong Hui Chol, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Youth League in Japan, visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun Thursday.
					 They paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues at the palace.
					
					 In the halls where the great leaders lie in state, the guests paid homage to them.
					
					 They went round the halls in which orders the great leaders received are on display and halls which house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Yun I Sang Concert Given
articles.content:
Yun I Sang Concert Given
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- There took place the 34th Yun I Sang Concert at the Moranbong Theatre on Thursday.
					 Among the audience were Pak Chun Nam, minister of Culture, Hong Kyong Ho, director of the Yun I Sang Music Institute, officials concerned, creators, artistes, teachers and students in the fields of stage art and art education and Pyongyangites.
					
					 The concert began with a pianoforte quintet "Oh, We Long for You". The performers made the use of musical expression of "Halo around the Moon", one of the lyric songs composed by Yun in the early period of his activities, and chamber symphony No. 2.
					
					 The concert was highly acclaimed by the audience for its successful combination of characteristics of folk music with modern aesthetic sense.

articles.title: National Competition among Hygienic Information Service Groups Held
articles.content:
National Competition among Hygienic Information Service Groups Held
Anju, November 5 (KCNA) -- A national competition among hygienic information service groups of health workers took place in Anju City, South Phyongan Province from Nov. 3 to 5.
					 The competition brought together more than 200 health workers of more than 10 organizations which proved successful in the regional preliminaries.
					
					 The participants successfully showcased the artistic skills acquired in the course of providing hygienic information service for preventing the epidemics rampant in the world such as Ebola virus infection and MERS and various noninfectious diseases in the past.
					
					 Put on the stage were numbers distinct in political stand and of great cognitional and educational significance in disseminating hygienic knowledge and strong in appeal and influence.

articles.title: Sports Facilities Increase in DPRK
articles.content:
Sports Facilities Increase in DPRK
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Numbers of sports facilities have been built or remodeled in different parts of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 A stadium with football field, volleyball and basketball courts and a running track appeared at the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex in Songrim City, North Hwanghae Province and a gymnasium covering an area of thousands of square meters in Hyesan City, Ryanggang Province.
					
					 Various sports establishments were built or renovated in North Phyongan Province. Gymnasiums took their shapes in Kwaksan and Yomju counties, swimming and wading pools in Hyangsan County and a gymnasium for 20-odd sports events at Sinuiju Teacher Training College.
					
					 Besides, sports parks and other facilities appeared in Jagang and South Hwanghae provinces to incite the inhabitants' enthusiasm for sports activities.

articles.title: Rungna Dolphinarium in Pyongyang Draws Many People
articles.content:
Rungna Dolphinarium in Pyongyang Draws Many People
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The Rungna Dolphinarium on scenic Rungna Islet in Pyongyang is daily crowded with visitors enjoying tricks of dolphins.
					 There dolphins, at the instruction of their trainers, perform such peculiar stunts and movements of high technique as beating with tail, taking flower in their mouth and numeral counting to delight the visitors. What draws special attention is a scene that dolphin kisses any spectator it likes. 
					
					 Visitors to the dolphinarium also can see a scene that dolphins show their specific skills, mixing with synchronized swimmers.
					
					 The number of programs performed by dolphins continues to increase thanks to their trainers' devoted efforts to give more pleasure to visitors.

articles.title: DPRK Will Take Toughest Counteraction against U.S. Moves to Stifle It: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
DPRK Will Take Toughest Counteraction against U.S. Moves to Stifle It: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The U.S. recently introduced nuclear carrier Ronald Reagan into the waters off Pusan and staged a large-scale joint naval drill together with the south Korean navy targeting the DPRK.
					 The U.S. newly formed five squadrons with the latest equipment under the pretext of intensifying international capability for watching nuclear test. The U.S. military warmongers openly said the basic task of the squadrons is to intensively watch and analyze nuclear activities of the DPRK. 
					
					 The U.S. is intentionally fanning up confrontation with the DPRK and aggravating the situation to incite war fever, Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a commentary. 
					
					 Referring to the goal of the U.S. aggravating tension, going against the DPRK's proposal for a peace treaty and aspiration of the world peace-loving people, the commentary goes on:
					
					 The U.S. is preventing the DPRK from directing efforts to peaceful economic construction in a bid to make it get used to the persistent tense situation and war drills and finally ignite a war against the DPRK and advance to the continent with the Korean Peninsula as a springboard. 
					
					 The U.S. is the ringleader disturbing peace and stability of the peninsula and rendering the whole world unstable by sparking off arms race and creating war atmosphere. The army and people of the DPRK will as ever take the toughest counteraction against the U.S. moves to stifle it.

articles.title: S. Korean Students Protest against S. Korea-Japan Talks
articles.content:
S. Korean Students Protest against S. Korea-Japan Talks
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- South Korean students staged a surprise demonstration toward Chongwadae in protest against south Korea-Japan talks on Nov. 2, according to the south Korean paper Media Today.
					 Enraged by the present regime's talks with Japan despite strong opposition by people from all walks of life, students marched towards Chongwadae, holding placards reading "Settle the issue of comfort women!", "No Self-Defense Force's advance into Korean Peninsula!" and "Humiliating south Korea-Japan summit talks".
					
					 They demanded Japan settle the issue of sexual slavery as early as possible and make an apology and reparation for its past crimes.
					
					 Riot police blocked their advance and walked off all of them.

articles.title: S. Korean Mayors, Governors Protest against "State-compiled" History Textbook
articles.content:
S. Korean Mayors, Governors Protest against "State-compiled" History Textbook
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- City mayors and provincial governors of south Korea are standing against "state-compiled" history textbook.
					 A relevant organ polled 17 mayors and governors across south Korea on Oct. 29. Eleven of them took negative attitude to the "state-compiled" history textbook.
					
					 They said that the moves to introduce the textbook are an act going against the trend of the times.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Conspiring with Japan
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Conspiring with Japan
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Civic and social organizations of south Korea including the Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society, the Peace Network, the Women's Society for Achieving Peace and the Federation of Women's Organizations made public a joint statement on Nov. 1 to denounce the authorities for their conspiracy with Japan.
					 The statement said that the south Korean and Japanese authorities are passive in settling the past crimes perpetrated by the Japanese imperialists such as sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army while seeking to tamper with history but they are buckling down to military cooperation and establishment of the triangular military alliance.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are working hard to instill their outlook on history into students and society by introducing the "state-compiled" history textbook, far from setting right Japan's wrong attitude, it noted.
					
					 It accused them of failing to take proper stand on Japan's increased provocations such as officially declaring the exercise of the "right to collective self-defense" and passage of security legislation and even making such reckless remarks about the possibility of the advance of Japan "Self-Defense Forces" into the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 It is important for south Korea and Japan to come out for improved relations with the north and show positive stand toward replacing the armistice system by peace mechanism, it stressed.

articles.title: Distortion of History Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Distortion of History Protested in S. Korea
Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The Ulsan Citizens Measure Committee to Check "State-compiled" History Textbook of south Korea held a candlelight rally in protest against the authorities' moves to introduce "state-compiled" history textbook on Oct. 30, according to south Korean internet newspaper Thongil News.
					 The speakers said that they can never entrust the compilation of history textbook to pro-Japanese elements, calling for checking the authorities' moves to introduce "state-compiled" history textbook without fail.
					
					 Members of the Teachers Union also called for fighting against the Ministry of Education and the "government."
					
					 Students of Ulsan City posted wall-papers denouncing the "state-compiled" history textbook in the compounds of their universities and staged demos in different places of the city.

articles.title: Inaugurado 34o Concierto Yun I Sang
articles.content:
Inaugurado 34o Concierto Yun I Sang
Pyongyang, 5 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 5 en el Teatro Moranbong el 34o Concierto Yun I Sang.
					Lo presenciaron el ministro de Cultura Pak Chun Nam, el director del Instituto de Musica Yun I Sang, Hong Kyong Ho, y otros funcionarios, creadores, artistas, profesores y estudiantes de ramas de arte escenica y educacion artistica y trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					En la escena iniciada con el quinteto de piano "Ah, anhelo", los actores describieron bien variadas obras creadas por Yun.
					
					La funcion armonizo las caracteristicas descriptivas propias de la musica nacional tradicional conforme al gusto contemporaneo, con lo cual fue aplaudida por los espectadores.

articles.title: RPDC respondera con intransigencia a la campana de aplastamiento de EE.UU., enfatiza Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
RPDC respondera con intransigencia a la campana de aplastamiento de EE.UU., enfatiza Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 5 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Recientemente, EE.UU. desarrollo junto con las fuerzas navales surcoreanas los ejercicios combinados maritimos de gran envergadura contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea bajo la participacion del portaaviones nuclear Ronald Reagan en el mar frente a Pusan. 
					Y organizo los 5 batallones de aviacion dotados de pertrechos sofisticados bajo el rotulo de consolidar la capacidad internacional de vigilancia de prueba nuclear. 
					
					Los belicistas del circulo militar norteamericano anunciaron abiertamente que los nuevos batallones asumen la mision principal de vigilar y analizar concentradamente las actividades nucleares de la RPDC. 
					
					De esta manera, EE.UU. intenta agravar mas la situacion y crear el ambiente de guerra contra la RPDC. 
					
					Revela el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual divulgado en su edicion de este jueves y continua:
					
					Entonces, ?cual es la verdadera intencion de EE.UU. que agrava la tension en contra de la propuesta de paz de la RPDC y la aspiracion de los pueblos pacifistas del mundo?
					
					Eso reside en impedir la inversion de la RPDC a la construccion de la economia pacifica y quedar relajado al pueblo coreano siendo acostumbrado con la tension permanente y los ejercicios belicos incesantes para asi desatar la guerra de agresion contra la RPDC y a la larga, avanzar al continente tomando como trampolin la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					EE.UU. es el perturbador de la paz y estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y acarreador de la carrera armamentista mundial y del ambiente de guerra. 
					
					Tanto en el pasado como en el futuro el ejercito y pueblo coreanos responderan con intransigencia a la campana de aplastamiento de EE.UU.

articles.title: Surcoreanos rechazan el "sistema de manual de historia redactado por el gobierno"
articles.content:
Surcoreanos rechazan el "sistema de manual de historia redactado por el gobierno"
Pyongyang, 5 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Segun el periodico online surcoreano Thong-il News, el comite de medidas de ciudadanos de Ulsan contra el "sistema de manual de historia redactado por el gobierno" sostuvo el dia 30 de octubre un mitin con velas. 
					En el mitin los oradores insistieron en frenar sin falta la aplicacion del sistema mencionado diciendo que no se puede depositar el manual de historia en los projaponeses. 
					
					Los miembros del Sindicato Nacional de Ensenantes exhortaron a luchar contra el Ministerio de Educacion y el "gobierno" cantando la cancion de rechazo a la aplicacion del "sistema de manual de historia redactado por el gobierno". 
					
					Los participantes desarrollaron una marcha de manifestacion. 
					
					Por otra parte, los estudiantes de la ciudad de Ulsan tambien libraron una manifestacion por doquier de la ciudad.

articles.title: Alcaldes y gobernadores rechazan aplicacion de "sistema de manual de historia redactado por gobierno"
articles.content:
Alcaldes y gobernadores rechazan aplicacion de "sistema de manual de historia redactado por gobierno"
Pyongyang, 5 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Los alcaldes y gobernadores provinciales del Sur de Corea expresaron la posicion negativa a la aplicacion del "sistema de manual de historia redactado por el gobierno".
					Segun la encuesta de la opinion publica realizada el dia 29 de octubre por un organo para 17 alcaldes y gobernadores de toda la region, los 11 de ellos tomaron la actitud negativa a la aplicacion del "sistema de manual de historia redactado por el gobierno".
					
					Dijeron ellos que es increible que el manual actual tiene problemas, ni aceptable a la aplicacion del manual redactado por el gobierno.
					
					Insistieron en que la aplicacion del "sistema de manual de historia redactado por el gobierno" contraviene a la corriente de la epoca.
